Addon.name: Blog
Addon.Help:
Blog Options
These settings can be accessed through the Options icon with Advanced Edit enabled on the Contensive Toolbar.

  • Blog Name - The name of the blog for this occurrence of the blog placed on a content page. Multiple blogs can be managed on one site
  • Allow Anonymous Comments - dictates if users must authenticate/register before commenting on a blog post
  • Overview Character Length - the amount of characters displayed on the overview page of a blog. The overview is created from the copy of the blog post. All HTML elements are removed from the overview.
  • Number of entries to display - the number of blog entries to display on the overview page before posts are added to the blog archive.

Multiple instances of the Blog Add-on may be included on a site. If Blog Name is set differently for each instance, multiple blogs can be managed.

With Allow Anonymous Comments set to Yes, anyone can post a comment to a blog. These comments require approval by the blog owner. If Allow Anonymous Comments is not set, users must authenticate prior to commenting on a blog. A log in form will automatically display for the user to provide a valid user name and password. If the Site Property "AllowMemberJoin" is set to True, users without a user name and password will be able to register with the site though a link marked "Join?" on the log in form. If the Site Property "AllowPasswordEmail" is set to True, users who have forgotten their user name or password will be able to request them using their email address through a link marked "Forgot your user name or password?" on the log in form.

All comments not posted by the blog owner will send an email notification to the blog owner. The email will contain the blog name the comment was posted to, and the name of the post the comment was posted to. The from address on the notification email can be set here Admin>Setting>Preferences on the tab labeled Email use the field "Default Email From Address".

Addon.name: blogSubscribeByEmailHandler

record.name: Blog Layout
record.field:
{{legacyBlog}}

Headline

This is the short description for the cell. It describes the cell quickly.

Email

Click Me

Field.Name: approved
Field.Caption: Approved
Field.HelpDefault: check to approve the comment, uncheck to block it.

Field.Name: name
Field.Caption: Subject
Field.HelpDefault: The subject entered for the comment

Field.Name: blogid
Field.Caption: Blog
Field.HelpDefault: The blog on which this comment was created.

Field.Name: entryid
Field.Caption: Blog Entry
Field.HelpDefault: The Post on which this comment was created.

Field.Name: name
Field.Caption: Blog Headline
Field.HelpDefault: The headline for your blog post.

Field.Name: datepublished
Field.Caption: Publish Date
Field.HelpDefault: The date this post appears on the site. Posts appear in this order. Set a future date will add the post on that date. If blank, the post's date added will be used.

Field.Name: copy
Field.Caption: Post
Field.HelpDefault: This is the actual copy for the entry

Field.Name: allowcomments
Field.Caption: Allow Comments
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, this entry allows comments

Field.Name: commentsreference
Field.Caption: Comments
Field.HelpDefault: Click open in New Window to see a list of all comments to this entry.

Field.Name: viewings
Field.Caption: Total Viewing Count
Field.HelpDefault: The number of times this entry was viewed on the website.

Field.Name: taglist
Field.Caption: Tag List
Field.HelpDefault: A comma separated list of tags. Tags can be searched on the website. An entry can be associated to any number of tags, and a tag can be in many entries.

Field.Name: authormemberid
Field.Caption: Author
Field.HelpDefault: Select the author for this Blog. This list is composed of all the members of the authors group. The author group is selected in the blog features, selected in the Blog selection for this record.

Field.Name: blogcategoryid
Field.Caption: Blog Category
Field.HelpDefault: Use Blog Categories to segregate your blog into sections. A category can be blocked with group permissions, and an entry can only belong to one category at a time. Tags are different in that an entry can belong to any number of tags

Field.Name: blogid
Field.Caption: Blog
Field.HelpDefault: This is the blog where this entry is associated.

Field.Name: blogpostpageid
Field.Caption: Blog Page Id
Field.HelpDefault: This is the Id of the page that this blog post is on

Field.Name: images
Field.Caption: Images
Field.HelpDefault: Click Open in New Window to see all the images associated with this entry. To add an image to a blg use the public blog interface.

Field.Name: primaryimagepositionid
Field.Caption: List View Primary Image Position
Field.LookupList: Use Stylesheet,Align Right,Align Left,Do Not Display
Field.HelpDefault: This selection determines how your primary image appears in the List View. The list view is the blog view that displays a list of blog entries. The Primary image is the first image in your blog post image list, when sorted by Alpha Sort order. Additional images are considered Secondary Images. The Primary image is always used for social media.

Field.Name: articleprimaryimagepositionid
Field.Caption: Article View Primary Image Position
Field.LookupList: Use Stylesheet,Align Right,Align Left,Do Not Display
Field.HelpDefault: This selection determines how your primary image appears in the article view. The article page is the blog view that displays the entire story. The Primary image is the first image in your blog post image list, when sorted by Alpha Sort order. Additional images are considered Secondary Images. The Primary image is always used for social media.

Field.Name: imagedisplaytypeid
Field.Caption: Secondary Images
Field.LookupList: Do Not Display,List Images After Post, Image Slider After Post
Field.HelpDefault: This selection determines how secondary images appear after the end of the article page. The article page is the blog view that displays the entire story. The Primary image is the first image in your blog post image list, when sorted by Alpha Sort order. Additional images are considered Secondary Images. The Primary image is always used for social media.

Field.Name: metatitle
Field.Caption: Title
Field.HelpDefault: The page title for this article. It may be used by search engines as the name shown to users during search. If blank the article name is used.

Field.Name: metadescription
Field.Caption: Description
Field.HelpDefault: The SEO page description for this article. It may be used by search engines as the description shown to users during search. If blank the article name is used.

Field.Name: metakeywordlist
Field.Caption: Keyword List
Field.HelpDefault: SEO keywords for this article. If blank the article name is used.

Field.Name: rssfeeds
Field.Caption: RSS Feeds
Field.HelpDefault: This entry will be seen in all the RSS Feeds checked. The RSS Feed set in the Blog record will be automatically checked when the entry is made on the public site.

Field.Name: rsstitle
Field.Caption: Title
Field.HelpDefault: This is the title to the RSS Feed entry created. This is automatically populated when the blog entry is made on the public site.

Field.Name: rssdescription
Field.Caption: Description
Field.HelpDefault: This is the RSS Feed description. It is created automatically when the blog entry is made on the public site.

Field.Name: rssdatepublish
Field.Caption: Date Publish
Field.HelpDefault: Set this date to block the entry from being shown before a particular date.

Field.Name: rssdateexpire
Field.Caption: Date Expires
Field.HelpDefault: Set this date to block the entry from being shown after a particular date.

Field.Name: rsslink
Field.Caption: RSS Link Override
Field.HelpDefault: Set this link if you want the RSS Feed entry to go somewhere else besides back to the Blog page where the entry was created.

Field.Name: podcastmedialink
Field.Caption: Podcast/Webcast Link
Field.HelpDefault: (optional) Enter the link to a media file. When present, this link will display on the page as a webcast, and will be included in RSS Feeds as a podcast.

Field.Name: podcastsize
Field.Caption: Webcast Player Size
Field.HelpDefault: Select a player size for the webscast.

Field.Name: header
Field.Caption: Header
Field.HelpDefault: Header for this blog entry

Field.Name: name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name given to this Latest Posts Widget.

Field.Name: padtop
Field.Caption: Top Padding
Field.HelpDefault: Add space between the edge of the block and the content.

Field.Name: padright
Field.Caption: Right Padding
Field.HelpDefault: Add space between the edge of the block and the content.

Field.Name: padbottom
Field.Caption: Bottom Padding
Field.HelpDefault: Add space between the edge of the block and the content.

Field.Name: padleft
Field.Caption: Left Padding
Field.HelpDefault: Add space between the edge of the block and the content.

Field.Name: backgroundimagefilename
Field.Caption: Background Image
Field.HelpDefault: Add a background image to the design block. It will be reduced in size to cover the entire background.

Field.Name: asfullbleed
Field.Caption: Add Container Margin for Full Bleed template
Field.HelpDefault: When not checked, this design block should be used within a container. When checked, the block is expected to span the full width of the screen and may create its own container.

Field.Name: styleheight
Field.Caption: Height (with units)
Field.HelpDefault: Optional. Set a style height and the design block will be forced this this height. Include both the number and the units, like 500px or 20em.

Field.Name: themestyleid
Field.Caption: Optional Layout Wrapper Class
Field.HelpDefault: Optional. Select a css class selector to be added to the block's wrapper. Use this feature to customize the layout styles. To add a custom style, add the css class selector in the content 'Design Block Themes' and add the css code to the style sheet in the site's theme addon.

Field.Name: fontstyleid
Field.Caption: Optional Layout Wrapper Class for Font (deprecated)
Field.HelpDefault: deprecated

Field.Name: defaultpostimage
Field.Caption: Default post image
Field.HelpDefault: If a post is does not have an image, it will use this image

Field.Name: name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name of the Blog. The blog includes all the blog posts. This name does not display on the website. Create a name that represents the subject of the blog

Field.Name: caption
Field.Caption: Caption
Field.HelpDefault: The publically visible caption for the blog that displays on the first page of the blog above the list of posts.

Field.Name: copy
Field.Caption: Description
Field.HelpDefault: The description is displayed on the first page of the blog above the list of posts. If you are including your blog in an RSS Feed, this description is included at the top of the Blog Feed.

Field.Name: ownermemberid
Field.Caption: Creator
Field.HelpDefault: The user initially created the blog. They are the primary author and have the ability to create posts. Administrators and those in the authoring group can also created posts.

Field.Name: entriesreference
Field.Caption: Posts
Field.HelpDefault: Click Entries to see a list of all the entries made to this blog.

Field.Name: rssfeedid
Field.Caption: RSS Feed
Field.HelpDefault: To create an RSS feed for your blog, select one from this list. If there are no Feeds created on the site, click See all RSS Feeds and create a new feed. To edit the RSS Feed name and description, click the Details link.

Field.Name: allowcategories
Field.Caption: Allow Categories
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, a blog category can be selected for each post. To create blog categories, click on blog categories in the admin navigator under blogs.

Field.Name: poststodisplay
Field.Caption: Number of Entries to Display
Field.HelpDefault: This is the number of entries to display when a list of entries is shown

Field.Name: overviewlength
Field.Caption: Overview Character Length
Field.HelpDefault: When multiple blog entries are listed, this is the limit to the number of characters for each blog entry

Field.Name: thumbnailimagewidth
Field.Caption: Thumbnail Image Width
Field.HelpDefault: The first optional image is placed in the entry text. This is the width of that image.

Field.Name: imagewidthmax
Field.Caption: Image Width Max
Field.HelpDefault: The width in pixels for optional images displayed below the entry.

Field.Name: ignorelegacyinstanceoptions
Field.Caption: Ignore Legacy Instance Options
Field.HelpDefault: This checkbox is used internally to signal the system to ignore older blog options.

Field.Name: emailcomment
Field.Caption: Email Authors When Comments Added
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, the blog authors will be emailed when a comment is added.

Field.Name: recaptcha
Field.Caption: Allow recaptcha for comments
Field.HelpDefault: When Checked reCaptcha will be used if users are allowed to add comments.

Field.Name: allowemailsubscribe
Field.Caption: Allow Email Subscribe
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, the sidebar will include a link to subscribe by email to this blog.

Field.Name: allowarticlecta
Field.Caption: Include Call-To-Action for Posts
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, the post can include a Call To Action section of the sidebar.

Field.Name: allowrsssubscribe
Field.Caption: Allow RSS Feed Subscribe
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, the sidebar will include a link to subscribe by RSS to this blog.

Field.Name: allowfacebooklink
Field.Caption: Allow Follow on Facebook
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, the sidebar will include a Follow This Blog section with a link to the Facebook account set below.

Field.Name: allowtwitterlink
Field.Caption: Allow Follow on Twitter
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, the sidebar will include a Follow This Blog section with a link to the Twitter account set below.

Field.Name: allowgooglepluslink
Field.Caption: Allow Follow on Google Plus
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, the sidebar will include a Follow This Blog section with a link to the Google plus account set below.

Field.Name: facebooklink
Field.Caption: Facebook Link
Field.HelpDefault: If Allow Follow on Facebook is checked, this is the link that will be used.

Field.Name: twitterlink
Field.Caption: TwitterLink
Field.HelpDefault: If Allow Follow on Twitter is checked, this is the link that will be used.

Field.Name: googlepluslink
Field.Caption: Google Plus Link
Field.HelpDefault: If Allow Follow on Google Plus is checked, this is the link that will be used.

Field.Name: emailsubscribegroupid
Field.Caption: Email Subscribe Group
Field.HelpDefault: if Allow Email Subscribe, this is the group that this user will be added to if they subscribe.

Field.Name: followuscaption
Field.Caption: Follow Us Caption
Field.HelpDefault: If any of the Allow Follow options are selected, this caption will appear over them.

Field.Name: allowarchivelist
Field.Caption: Allow Archive List
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, if there are articles from previous months, a list of months will be shown in the sidebar. If one is clicked, a list of blog posts from that month are displayed.

Field.Name: allowsearch
Field.Caption: Allow Search
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, the sidebar will include a text search box

Field.Name: metatitle
Field.Caption: Title
Field.HelpDefault: Metadata for the blog landing page.

Field.Name: metadescription
Field.Caption: Description
Field.HelpDefault: Metadata for the blog landing page.

Field.Name: metaKeywordList
Field.Caption: Keyword List
Field.HelpDefault: Metadata for the blog landing page.

Field.Name: padtop
Field.Caption: Top Padding
Field.HelpDefault: Add space between the edge of the block and the content.

Field.Name: padright
Field.Caption: Right Padding
Field.HelpDefault: Add space between the edge of the block and the content.

Field.Name: padbottom
Field.Caption: Bottom Padding
Field.HelpDefault: Add space between the edge of the block and the content.

Field.Name: padleft
Field.Caption: Left Padding
Field.HelpDefault: Add space between the edge of the block and the content.

Field.Name: backgroundimagefilename
Field.Caption: Background Image
Field.HelpDefault: Add a background image to the design block. It will be reduced in size to cover the entire background.

Field.Name: asfullbleed
Field.Caption: Add Container Margin for Full Bleed template
Field.HelpDefault: When not checked, this design block should be used within a container. When checked, the block is expected to span the full width of the screen and may create its own container.

Field.Name: styleheight
Field.Caption: Height (with units)
Field.HelpDefault: Optional. Set a style height and the design block will be forced this this height. Include both the number and the units, like 500px or 20em.

Field.Name: themestyleid
Field.Caption: Optional Layout Wrapper Class
Field.HelpDefault: Optional. Select a css class selector to be added to the block's wrapper. Use this feature to customize the layout styles. To add a custom style, add the css class selector in the content 'Design Block Themes' and add the css code to the style sheet in the site's theme addon.

Field.Name: active
Field.Caption: Active
Field.HelpDefault: When inactive, this blog will not show up in a blog list, but if the blog is directly referenced on a page, a new empty blog will be created. Do not set a blog inactive if it is used on the site.

Field.Name: allowanonymous
Field.Caption: Allow Anonymous Comments
Field.HelpDefault: When true, anyone can add comments without authentication

Field.Name: autoapprovecomments
Field.Caption: Auto-Approve New Comments
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, comments are approved automatically. When not checked, new comments are saved but not visible to the public. You can have the system email the blog authors when a comment is added with the Email Authors checkbox.

Field.Name: authoringgroupid
Field.Caption: Authoring Group
Field.HelpDefault: (optional) When set, this group will also be able to create posts to this blog. They will receive an email when anyone adds a comment, if "Auto-Approve New Comments" is not checked.
